summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing the status of the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. It covers plans to indict Ghislaine Maxwell, efforts to interview Prince Andrew via an MLAT request, and ongoing surveillance and investigative steps.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Subject of MLAT request and potential interview
persons.context: The Duke of York; his counsel is issuing a public statement in response to an MLAT request from SDNY prosecutors seeking to interview him regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell; the FBI discusses plans to obtain a six-count indictment against her, details the proposed charges, and mentions ongoing surveillance (mail cover, pen register) on her believed location.

persons.name: John
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the sender has not heard from regarding SDNY's plans to speak with the U.S. Attorney about the investigation.

connections.description: Both are subjects of discussion in the same FBI email regarding the Epstein investigation; the investigation into Maxwell is ongoing while efforts are made to interview Prince Andrew.

events.title: FBI internal update on Epstein/Maxwell investigation
events.description: FBI officials exchange emails detailing the status of the investigation, including planned charges against Maxwell and efforts to interview Prince Andrew.

events.title: Planned indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: SDNY plans to seek a six-count indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell once a grand jury is available. The charges include conspiracy to entice, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and two counts of perjury.

events.title: MLAT request for Prince Andrew interview
events.description: Prosecutors have made an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) request to interview Prince Andrew. His counsel is preparing a public statement in response, and SDNY plans to issue a counter-statement.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) planned to indict Ghislaine Maxwell on six specific criminal counts related to the Epstein case.
SDNY prosecutors had made an MLAT request to interview Prince Andrew and were engaged in discussions with his counsel, though no interview was immediately scheduled.
The FBI had active surveillance on Maxwell, including a mail cover on a believed address and a renewed pen register on her phone, with plans for physical surveillance.
The email chain reveals internal FBI coordination and planning regarding high-profile aspects of the Epstein investigation in June 2020.
